name: Druid user access.txt - Druid User Authentication/Authorisation
description: This section appears to be about the authentication process in Druid, which is a crucial aspect of user access control. Authentication is the process of verifying the identity of a user or system before granting access to resources or services. It ensures that only authorized individuals or entities can access sensitive data or perform specific actions within the Druid system.
use_cases: Controlling access to Druid resources and services

name: Druid user access.txt - Authentication
description: This section explains how to create a new user and assign a password to that user for authentication in the Druid system. It provides command-line instructions using cURL to send HTTP requests to the Druid coordinator service, which handles user management and authentication. The process involves creating a new user entry and then setting a password for that user.

name: Druid user access.txt - Authorization
description: This section explains how to set up user authorization and access control in Druid, a data analytics platform. It provides step-by-step instructions for creating roles, assigning permissions to roles, creating users, and assigning roles to users. This allows administrators to control which users can access and perform specific actions on data sources and other resources within the Druid system.
use_cases: Managing user access and permissions in Druid
Implementing role-based access control (RBAC) in Druid
Securing sensitive data sources and resources in Druid
Controlling user actions and operations on data sources in Druid

name: Druid user access.txt - References
description: This section provides a cURL command that allows an administrator to assign a specific role to a user in the Druid Basic Security extension. The command sends a POST request to the Druid Coordinator with the necessary authentication credentials, specifying the user and role names. This allows the administrator to manage user access and permissions within the Druid system.
use_cases: Managing user roles and permissions in Druid
Assigning roles to users for access control
Configuring user authorization in Druid Basic Security extension
